HDG.QB.content: essence of nihilism can never be decided by judiciary of ratio, which unthinkingly thrusts everything inappropriate to it into alleged mire of irrational (a mire it itself first delimits) > reason & its representational activity only one kind of thinking, not self-determined, determined by that which called upon thinking to think in the manner of ratio [i.e. essence of ratio not ratio] [cf. Gay Science 111] > domination of ratio (leveling out/standardization) accompanied by attempts to flee into irrational

HDG.QB.content: Heidegger confesses: “I myself was not focused enough to articulate w/ sufficient clarity the reasons for my suggestion” [re: why he encouraged Jünger to reissue The Worker in original form] > now the time may have become more ready to say something [only may, not there yet]

HDG.QB.content: transcendence ambiguous for essential reasons w/in metaphysics > meanings of transcendence: 1) relation proceeding from beings & passing over to being 2) relation leading from changeable beings to an entity that is at rest 3) supreme entity itself > meta-physical in metaphysics = transcendence

HDG.QB.content: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it

HDG.FS.content: for Kant, ground of everything, only idea (opposed to intuition/concept) of speculative reason, ungrounded, abyssal > Kant witnessed with horror what began to take place w/ Fichte: Fichte & Hegel look for ground where for Kant there’s only abyss

HDG.FS.content: Kant emphasizes finitude/powerlessness of speculative reason > Hegel makes it instrument of philosophical activity, speculation becomes autonomous, unveils power impossible for Kant
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Kant emphasizes finitude/powerlessness of speculative reason > Hegel makes it instrument of philosophical activity, speculation becomes autonomous, unveils power impossible for Kant

HDG.FS.content: for Kant, power of conjoining withdraws before the Understanding, unity hasn’t disappeared but remains in background > over-interpreting, Reason as faculty of unity, perceiving of Being, withdraws behind Understanding (for Kant): ontological difference is at stake (im Spiel ist) > understanding can’t grasp/determine absolute synthesis

HDG.FS.content: [Kant’s] understanding incapable of understanding how limitations at heart of reason, abolished once referred to absolute, are produced in this “abolishing” relation (“vernichtenden” Bezug): there is “appeasement (Befriedigung)”: fixities disappear, while oppositions appear in their vitality (Lebendigkeit)

HDG.FS.content: Hegel: “Reason constructs itself in its emanation as an identity that is conditioned by this very duplicate [Reason’s appearance]” > acc. Heidegger, understand Hegel by explicating “infinite world-intuition” > intuition—individual; concept—general

HDG.FS.content: Kant: “I have therefore found it necessary to deny (aufheben) knowledge, in order to make room for faith” > precisely this bringing-to-its-place (an-seinen-Ort-bringen) of theoretical knowledge [this Aufhebung] allows corresponding location (entsprechende Ortschaft) of practical reason to become visible

HDG.FS.content: for Hegel, all moments (reflection, construction, production, contraction) when grasping of Absolute by Reason are accomplished takes place in “consciousness”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hegel, all moments (reflection, construction, production, contraction) when grasping of Absolute by Reason are accomplished takes place in “consciousness”

HDG.FS.content: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]

HDG.FS.content: “positing” (or positio) has several meanings, thesis in sense of “to have standing before oneself (vor sich stehend haben)” > this helps us understand why, for Hegel, 2nd moment of absolute Reason is “Construction”: Absolute must be “constructed” for consciousness, construction is also production

HDG.FS.content: more disturbing than space conquest, transformation of biology into biophysics: human can be produced acc. definite plan like any technological object > science can’t stop in time, can’t limit human desire for knowledge > reason for this event: modern relation to power (political), new form of nationalism must be thought through

HDG.MA.content: at core of his being, man has capacity to think, destined to think: has “spirit and reason” [cf. ATIA]

HDG.OHF.content: [history of the concept of “Man”] 1) living being endowed w/ reason (via Aristotle) 2) person or personhood (Christian explication guided by Revelation in Old Testament) > but logos never meant “reason” for Aristotle, but discourse (Rede), conversation (Gespräch): man as a being that has its world in mode (Weise) of something addressed (der Angesprochenen) [man in language]
